subject: RE: [junit] Control test order in base test case hierarchy.

messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> Sent: Saturday, June 26, 2004 5:04 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Control test order in base test case hierarchy.
>
>
> Ray Tayek wrote:
> > ... as soon as I use suite() to control the order, junit does not
> > find the tests in the super-classes of that test case.
> >
> > I am using the textui runner from main()in each base test case ...
>
> Eclipse's JUnit test runner doesn't handle certain suite() methods
> properly. I have a defect ...
>
> > Is there a way to do this so that it works regardless of the test
> > runner and the environment?
>
> Not when one environment's test runner has a defect ...
>
> If you need this feature, don't run your tests with Eclipse's test
> runner: use main() instead. Less good, but it works.

Yes, every package has an all tests and each test case has both a suite()
that includes a call to the super classes suite() and a main() that runs
textui on suite(). So I shoud be ok in mosy cases. I do get the green bar
when running in eclipse as a junit (but I have not tried any swingrunner nor
any junit from ant in eclipse).

thanks
